alert.note: Alert for San Joaquin (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 22 at 4:01AM PST until January 22 at 12:45PM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PST TODAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following counties, Amador, Calaveras, San Joaquin, Stanislaus and Tuolumne. * WHEN...Until noon PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 400 AM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated moderate to heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Stockton, Modesto, Tracy, Oakdale, Sonora, Jackson, San Andreas, Paloma, Manteca, Lodi, Riverbank, Lathrop, Ripon, Escalon, Milton, Eugene, Rancho Calaveras, Farmington, Telegraph City and Hodson. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
